content: keyhole ripple scarf ripple stitches are a classic crochet stitch pattern that replace the usual grid pattern of crochet stitches with elegant undulating lines these stitch patterns use regular increases and decreases in each row the increase becomes the high point of the ripple and the decrease becomes the low point of the ripple this pattern just repeats row 2 so is easy to internalize once blocked the regularly spaced holes give a lacy effect that makes for a fabric that still has substance and warmth but has pleasing drape finished dimensions 63 long 7 wide after blocking materials ● 3 skeins of valley yarns northfield 70% merino 20% baby alpaca 10% silk 124 yds ● size 4mm crochet hook or size to obtain correct gauge ● tapestry needle gauge 5 = 2 full pattern repeats 9 row heather mcqueen vireo99@gmail com instagram vireo99 facebook vireo fibercrafts ravelry heatha keyhole ripple scarf pattern 10 stitches in each pattern repeat starting chain must be a multiple of 10 + 3 chain 33 or more for a wider scarf row 1 double_crochet in 4th chain from hook 3 skipped chain count as double_crochet pm in chain-3 of skipped chain double_crochet in the next 3 chain *skip 2 chain** double_crochet in next 4 chain chain 2 double_crochet in next 4 chain repeat from * across last repeat ends at ** double_crochet in the next 3 chain 2dc in last chain pm in 2nd double_crochet turn row 2 chain 3 pm in 3rd chain of chain-3 chain 3 counts as double_crochet here and in all subsequent row double_crochet in 1st double_crochet the one you marked at the end of the last row remove marker double_crochet in the next 3 double_crochet *skip 2 double_crochet ** double_crochet in the next 3 double_crochet double_crochet ch2 double_crochet in next chain-2 space double_crochet in next 3 double_crochet repeat from * across ending last repeat at ** double_crochet in next 3 double_crochet 2 double_crochet in marked tch pm in 2nd double_crochet turn repeat row 2 for pattern for 89 row or until desired length fasten_off weave in ends block heather mcqueen vireo99@gmail com instagram vireo99 facebook vireo fibercrafts ravelry heatha
